definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
to prepare herbal medicine by roasting or parching (in a pan)
to sauté/to fry/to dry by heating

sentences.english: The history of Liuyang fireworks dates back to the year 1740.
sentences.chinese: 浏阳花炮创制于1740年，生产历史悠久。

sentences.english: The invention relates to a nano-modified firework holder adhesive and the preparation method thereof.
sentences.chinese: 本发明涉及一种纳米改性花炮底座胶及其制备方法。

sentences.english: My firecrackers also is very beautiful, but the most good-looking to several magic bullet.
sentences.chinese: 我的花炮也很美，但最好看的要数魔术弹。

sentences.english: Chinese fireworks products have taken a pivotal position in the international market, with the increasingly fierce of market competition.
sentences.chinese: 中国花炮产品在国际市场上具有举足轻重的地位。

sentences.english: There is no doubt that Liuyang Fireworks encounter a golden opportunity for development.
sentences.chinese: 毫无疑问，浏阳花炮遇到了一个千载难逢的发展机遇。

sentences.english: My factory will be Fireworks traditional crafts and modern science and technology the perfect combination.
sentences.chinese: 我厂将花炮传统工艺和现代科技完美结合。

sentences.english: The invention can be widely used for decoration project and firework pot adhesion.
sentences.chinese: 本发明可广泛用于装饰工程和花炮组盆粘接。

definition: colored lantern (used at Lantern Festival 元宵節|元宵节)
fuse (for explosives)/(fig.) proximate cause/the last straw
sky lantern (miniature hot-air balloon used during festivals)
festival entertainment (lion dance, dragon lantern etc)
firecrackers set off at the stroke of midnight on New Year's Day (a Chinese tradition)
